## DataFile interface

Represents a physical file or remote dataset that has been loaded. This allows us to keep track of and represent to the user any data loaded into the system. For example, if they drag/drop a file, this will hold a copy of the raw original table, even if the app uses derived copies.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface DataFile 
```

|  [origin](./types.datafile.origin.md) |  | [FileOrigin](./types.fileorigin.md) |  |
|  [rows?](./types.datafile.rows.md) |  | number | <i>(Optional)</i> |

|  [tableType?](./types.datafile.tabletype.md) |  | [ItemType](./types.itemtype.md) | <i>(Optional)</i> If the user has indicated whether this is nodes, edges, etc. |
|  [url](./types.datafile.url.md) |  | string |  |
